lessons.title: Reviewing Whole Numbers through Fun Assessments
lessons.lecture:
Hello everyone! Today marks our exciting assessment day where we will review our knowledge of whole numbers. This will not only be an evaluation of what you have learned this week, but it will also be fun and engaging! We have a couple of different activities planned to help reinforce what you have learned about whole numbers, so let’s dive right in!

First up, we’ll start with some review games. These games are designed to help you recall important concepts about whole numbers, including addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. You’ll be allowed to work at your own pace, and I encourage you to think about strategies as you play. Remember, the goal is not just to find the right answer, but to understand how you got there. [p]

After our review games, we'll take a few minutes for individual reflection. During this time, I want you to think about what strategies worked well for you during the games and what areas you might still be unsure about. You can jot down your thoughts in a notebook if you have one available. Reflecting on your own learning process is key to improvement! [p]

Now, once we’ve reflected, we’ll move onto a performance assessment. This will be a more formal check on your understanding of whole numbers, where you will encounter various problems that reflect what you have learned throughout the week. It’s important to read each question carefully and show your work, so I can see the process you used to arrive at your answer. [p]

As we engage in these activities, remember that this is not just about scoring well; it’s about learning and growing in your understanding of whole numbers. So, let’s have fun, learn together, and see how well you can apply what you've learned so far! [p]
lessons.summary: In today’s lesson, we engaged in review games to reinforce your understanding of whole numbers and their operations. You had the opportunity to reflect on your learning, considering what strategies worked best for you. Lastly, through a performance assessment, you had the chance to demonstrate your understanding of the concepts we covered this week. This holistic approach allows us to not only assess knowledge but also to encourage a growth mindset towards learning!

lecture_questions.question: What is a primary benefit of renewable energy sources compared to fossil fuels?
options: 4) They are more expensive to implement overall.
1) They are more limited in resource availability.
3) They are sustainable and have lower environmental impacts.

lecture_questions.explanation: Renewable energy sources, such as solar and wind, are considered sustainable because they can be replenished naturally and do not exhaust resources like fossil fuels. Additionally, they typically produce far fewer greenhouse gases, making them more environmentally friendly.
